DOC.brief_summary: This is an 8-week, multi-centre, Open-label, non-comparative study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Quetiapine XR with daily dose 400mg-800mg used as mono-therapy in the treatment of acute schizophrenic patients. The eligible patient will be assigned to study treatment with Quetiapine XR on Day 1. PLEASE NOTE: Seroquel SR and Seroquel XR refer to the same formulation. The SR designation was changed to XR after consultation with FDA.
DOC.brief_title: Study of the Efficacy and Safety of Quetiapine Fumarate Extended Release (Seroquel XR)
DOC.criteria: Documented clinical diagnosis meeting the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 4th edition (DSMIV) criteria PANSS total score of at least 70 at enrolment and at assignment Day 1 CGI Severity of Illness score of at least 4 (moderately ill) at enrolment and at assignment Day 1 and with worsening of the patient's condition during the 3 weeks Known intolerance or lack of response to quetiapine fumarate Administration of a depot antipsychotic injection within one dosing interval (for the depot) before assignment Substance or alcohol dependence at enrolment Opiates, amphetamine, barbiturate, cocaine, cannabis, or hallucinogen abuse by DSMIV criteria within 4 weeks prior to enrolment
